name: Spezzatino Di Manzo (Italian Beef Stew)
keywords: Italian Beef Stew, Spezzatino di manzo, Beef Stew, Winter, Hearty, Potato, Rich, Comfort Food, Slow Cooked, Italian Cuisine, Beef, Stew, One-Pot, Dinner, Family Friendly, Cold Weather, Braised Beef, Fall, Comfort, Rustic, Classic Italian
description: Hearty winter stew that will surely satisfy everyone in the house.

recipeInstructions.text: Coat beef cubes in flour. Heat about a tablespoon of oil in a large non-stick pot over high heat. Add beef only adding enough to make 1 layer. Cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until browned all over. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with rest of the beef, reheating the pan and adding more oil between batches.
recipeInstructions.name: Brown Beef

recipeInstructions.text: With no beef in the pot add the pancetta, carrot, celery, onion and garlic to the pan and cook while stirring. Cook this mix until onion is soft. Add the wine and ensure that you scrape any of the nice cooked bits off the bottom. Add everything but the parsley and potatoes to the pot and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 2 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Saut√© Vegetables and Simmer

recipeInstructions.text: Uncover, add potatoes and simmer for 40 minutes or until the beef is tender, the sauce is thick and the potatoes are cooked through. Make sure it doesn't start burning during this stage, add extra water if it gets too thick and the beef/potatoes aren't tender enough still. During this stage taste and season with salt and pepper as required.
recipeInstructions.name: Add Potatoes and Simmer

notes: For an extra kick, add a bit of chili to the stew.
This dish can also be enjoyed without potatoes and served with rice instead.
